column1: Table D2.14.1: Access to homelands/traditional country, by remoteness, Indigenous Australians aged 18 and over, 2018–19(a)

column2: Identifies with a clan, tribal or language group(b)

column6: Allowed to visit homelands/ traditional country
column9: Does not recognise homelands/ traditional country

column1: * Represents statistically significant differences at the p < 0.05 level. Differences between percentages were tested within columns, using ‘Total remote’ as the reference category.
† Estimate has a relative standard error between 25% and 50% and should be used with caution.

‡ Estimate has a relative standard error greater than 50% and are considered unreliable for general use.  Differences between those percentages with a ‡ and the percentages of the reference category could not be tested for significance.
(a) Includes only those present at the interview.
(b) More than 1 response allowed. Categories include: a tribal group, a language group, a clan, a mission, Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander/Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander group.
(c) Includes 'don't know whether allowed to visit homelands/traditional country'.
(d) Includes refusal and not known responses.
Note: Cells in this table have been randomly adjusted to avoid the release of confidential data. Discrepancies may occur between sums of the component items and totals.
Source: AIHW and ABS analysis of National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health Survey 2018–19.
